job_title: Registered Nurse Emergency Department in Saint Joseph, MO
pros: My co-workers are absolutely fantastic. I don't think I've ever worked anywhere with such genuinely good people-legitimately, it's difficult to leave the community there.
cons: The HR department makes it very difficult to move up in pay scale. A nurse is a nurse to them-no matter how many certifications you have or what specialty area you work in. You don't get compensation for your additional knowledge, and raises are based on annual 'reviews' that are a flat rate of around 0.80 if you make them happy enough to get the whole thing.

job_title: Environmental Services Technician in Saint Joseph, MO

Tenure employees are unwelcoming to new employees because they are frustrated before their shift even starts.
Certain managers are unprofessional, short tempered, unengaged, and lack people skills and social ques. review_title: Talk to current or former employees before excepting a position
job_title: Business Analyst in Saint Joseph, MO
pros: Ability to help people in need.  If you're in a clinical position, many opportunities exist.  They will help you obtain clinical education.  Pay is not bad, but could be better to stay competitive.
cons: Tends to promote "Yes" people into management positions in which they have very little experience.  Upper management style is mostly by intimidation.  Definite hierarchy and pecking order...and often reminded.  Information not passed down to rank & file staff.  Lack of communication among departments and many are quick to blame others rather than be accountable.  History of "eliminating positions" of loyal, long-term employees with great performance & track record.  Many double standards established within work groups.

job_title: Critical Care Registered Nurse in Saint Joseph, MO
pros: Good clean environment.  The Hospital thrives to make it better for the surrounding community, better and safer for the patients that come into our hospital.
cons: Constant changes, JACHO rules and regulations make it very hard for the nurse to actually get more time with the patient.  We are always changing our standards and the way of practicing nursing or medial treatment for the patient.  Some are good changes, but some are not.  Just too much change.

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Kansas City, MO
pros: Fellow coworkers and providers are fantastic,  really care about their patients.
cons: Leadership and management don't have experience providing care and don't realize what goes into caring for patients and the commitment you have to your patients. It's too easy for them to close one door and think we should be ok closing that door on patients too. They don't realize that patients and coworkers become your second family, we truly care about their wellbeing and future. They see $$$ and numbers on paper.

job_title: Critical Care RN in Saint Joseph, MO
pros: It’s hard to get fired due to so much turnover-it’s actually not that bad compared to other places if you get on the right floor-level one trauma ER so experience with very complicated cases is nice to have
cons: It’s high stress and the outside work they make you do is ridiculous-it felt like I couldn’t escape there some weeks-it’s also just scary sometimes-I’ve seen some traumatic things that I still have nightmares about-the opioid and meth crisis is alive and well and sometimes doctors are withholding pain meds for fear of doing harm or getting sued-even hospice patients

review_title: An great place to Work, Until.....

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Joseph, MO
pros:
*The staff are welcoming and friendly
*The benefits are phenomenal
*Patients do come first here

Not only is this going directly against what the rest of the country is doing, but it is disheartening to see an organization I love this much turn away from the core values that brought me here to begin with.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Joseph, MO
pros: It is a better than minimum wage job. Those are few and far between in Saint Joseph, MO and offers tuition assistance if you are lucky.
cons: Inadequate staffing-always understaffed, management never available. Dept head more interested in playing with the boss than running the department. Rules interpreted to fit the situation or employees. One you fire someone for becoming dangerously ill at work you have a real problem. When you don't discipline other employees for not getting this person the help needed you have an even bigger problem. Aren't hospitals supposed to be kind, caring and compassionate? This is a hospital trying desperately to be one of the big boys and failing badly.

review_title: Decent place to work, depending who you know
job_title: Anonymous in Saint Joseph, MO
pros: Great benefits, most departments work well together, able to understand when you take a problem directly to the top
cons: Too many managers between the staff and the service leader. OOP max is too high for the average employee, needs to be more patient focused and less financial focused. You cannot chase money and win, you must chase the patient to help them and the money will follow.

review_title: Management top heavy / slow decision making process and constantly changing goals
job_title: Physical Therapy in Saint Joseph, MO
pros: The company does have decent health insurance and available resources to improve one's health and work toward health goals.
cons: salaries for hourly professionals tend to be in the bottom 10% compared to the median salary for a profession according to labor statistics.

review_title: It used to be a great place . . .
job_title: Critical Care RN in Saint Joseph, MO
pros: I spent a career total of 6 years here, 5 of them were great.  Cafeteria and gift shop were off payroll, numerous classes to take, plenty of time for orientation, rich learning environment, learned mostly by hands on, excellent communication with physicians l, nurses, and other staff. My particular unit has amazing teamwork and we took care of each other and treated the new staff like they were our own. Physician call list easy to access. Cafeteria had multiple selections as far as food items. Campus rather easy to navigate, with guest services in tow to help when needed. Can't forget the coffee shop downstairs which also took payroll deduct!!
cons: The last 6-8 months of my 6 years there took a gradual bad turn. I was being pulled into the office for random minute details, such as forgetting ice water, and being told I didn't update a patient and their family about their care when there was nothing that had changed. I was unfortunately targeted by leadership regarding these minor issues, yet I never harmed or deteriorated a patient's status. It broke my heart.  I was also told I was "ditzy" by an associate team leader and I was offended.  Being told I wasn't doing my job by the opposite shift when they proceeded to raise their voice to me in the hallway and turn the heads of others, how disrespectful! I never thought I would ever be treated this way and thrown under the bus by the opposite shift, who whined about the prettiest things, god forbid if I asked them to give a med for me because the patient was nauseated or if appropriateness wasn't there. I was ultimately written up after written up, and I couldn't voluntarily leave at the time due to commitments, ultimately I was terminated. I still can't believe how little transpired to be treated like this. Leadership did not care to hear what I had to say regarding any of it. I really thought I was going to do longer nursing career there. It makes me so sad.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Saint Joseph, MO
pros:
I worked with a mostly amazing staff and all of the physicians and NP's where excellent and inspiring

Beautiful buildings and very impressive atmosphere. The patients really appreciated what you did for them.
cons:
Direct manager was unavailable to staff, did not want to discuss growth ideas, and was quite rude when discussing work related conflicts. Manager lied regarding quit date that was fulfilled.

HR employees where also not wonderful but the HR manager was very understanding and would listen to concerns.

job_title: CNA in Portales, NM
pros: The residents at the facility make the job worth working at, because they keep me on my toes.  If it weren't for them, i do not think i would have been here this long.
cons: There is not much communications there at all. Sometimes the employees, especially the CNA's are left in the dark on many issues concerning the admission of new residents.  Also, the nurses are always sitting at the desk and if you ask for a hand in something, they look as if you said something wrong to them.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Joseph, MO
